instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Boots and runs great. Screen suddenly goes of. No backlight, no picture.
threads.message:
Like the subject says. Board has reported liquid (coffee) damage although I can't see anything.

Machine appears to still be running ok. HDMI port appears to be damaged so can't test external screen.

Thinking I'll start by investigating <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Boots and runs great. Screen suddenly goes of. No backlight, no picture.
threads.message: Check external with thunderbolt to VGA adapter. Or clean it up and hope Apple will accept it under the GPU recall.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Boots and runs great. Screen suddenly goes of. No backlight, no picture.
threads.message:
Thanks.
Couldn't get an external screen to show a picture despite it detecting it was plugged in.

Cleaned up and returning under the recall program.
